intro: Tanacetopsis handeliiformis, commonly known as the Händel's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
